column4: Can anyone help me with this http://pastebin.com/d4289be20 im using Hardy Heron amd64 build, and im also using gfxboot grub. I ran into this problem before and dont remember how it was fixed. Please help
have you tried issuing:  sudo apt-get -f install
not yet, should i go thru each package or can i pass the force with "sudo apt-get upgrade"?
just type "sudo apt-get -f install" first and nothing else
it seems you have some packages unconfigured and that can fix it.
same outcome
I'd be stuck as well at that point.
well thanks for taking a look
what happened to have you experience that ?
it only happens when linux-image-'uname -r' and linux-ubuntu-modules, image, etc are updated
its directly related to gfxboot grub but i dont remember why
take a look at line 4, 5, & 6.. its running /sbin/update-grub and running into a problem
can you pastebin your contents of /sbin/update-grub for me?
I wouldn't want to update grub right now. The machine I have ubuntu installed is functioning as a file server...
i just need a file to reference my update-grub to
hold on I did it.
http://pastebin.com/m64258253
no, dont acctually run update-grub... do this.. "gedit /sbin/update-grub"
then copy and paste the contents of the file
using pastebin of course
http://pastebin.com/m132cfa7e
thanks mate, i appreciate it
no mention
